result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM CO: TCH for RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Syrgeo Romeo Perez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Syrgeo Romeo Perez.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harrelson requests to lift no contact provision of bond and gives argument. ADA Becker objects to modification and gives argument. Court reviews CHIPS cases. Court denies bond modification at this time, as this motion should be brought before Judge Waterman in this matter. Court will set internal review for Judge Waterman. Attys jointly request to continue MH. Court resets MH.  gll
Review scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 07:45 am.

Motion hearing on December 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Bail/bond hearing on September 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:03 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Alec Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Syrgeo Romeo Perez in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Syrgeo Romeo Perez. INCLUDES 22CF107 (RW) and 22CF330 (INIT).  22CF330: DE received copy of complaint, updates address. Prelim time limits waived. Court sets MH on 22CF107 and STC on 22CF330. Court sets bond. DE requests bond modification in 22CF107. ADA Ballo objects. Court modifies bond. Adjourned: 1:10 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

* AMENDED *

$250 ON FILE. 

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.R.T & J.C.T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jessica H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Motion hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug and alcohol testing, random ETG testing at least 2 times per week. CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Syrgeo Romeo Perez appeared. Case called at 8:54 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. Atty Harrelson has received a copy of the information and has reviewed with client. NG plea entered. ADA Ellenwood requesting input from social worker and Judge on the child protection case. Court DENIES request for bond modification at this time. Address confirmed. TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF108 & 22CF107 
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman and  DF:  Jessica Lynn Howlett appeared in 22CF108. DE ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and DF: Syrgeo Romeo Perez appeared in 22CF107. Case called at 2:05 p.m. Court notes both matters are scheduled for preliminary hearing. Court notes receiving a letter filed from Mr. Perez on 22CF107 requesting new counsel. Atty Harrelson has spoke to client in regards to the request and DE has withdrawn request. DE Mr. Perez confirms.  ADA Rockow calls Det. Ryan Bleskey to the Stand. S/T Ryan Bleskey. Employed with the City of Hudson Police Department. Direct by ADA Rockow. Witness identifies both DE's in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Chapman. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Rockow. No further evidence by either party. No argument by Atty Chapman. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Argues probable cause.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in both 22CF107 & 22CF108. Atty Chapman is prepared to continue arraignment today. ADA Rockow requesting matters be scheduled out. Court schedules. Atty Chapman is requesting bond be modified to no abusive contact. ADA Rockow objects. Court will amend bond.  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
from DE requesting a new attorney. Per RMW, leave as scheduled. Will address at hearing. hml
Filed by Atty Harrelson. km

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Syrgeo Romeo Perez appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint.
